body_html:
Updates: Changing the NDK to r17b seems to fix this problem. Tested on master and tag v1.9.0 with both the ARM v7 and ARM v8 versions of the command.

That said, when using NDK r17b, I get the following message from bazel:

The major revision of the Android NDK referenced by android_ndk_repository rule 'androidndk' is 17. 
The major revisions supported by Bazel are [10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16]. 
Bazel will attempt to treat the NDK as if it was r16. 
This may cause compilation and linkage problems. 
Please download a supported NDK version.

Is this warning message out of date? Does TensorFlow for Android now expect/depend upon r17b to function?

body:
Updates: Changing the NDK to `r17b` seems to fix this problem. Tested on `master` and tag `v1.9.0` with both the ARM v7 and ARM v8 versions of the command.

That said, when using NDK `r17b`, I get the following message from `bazel`:

```
The major revision of the Android NDK referenced by android_ndk_repository rule 'androidndk' is 17. 
The major revisions supported by Bazel are [10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16]. 
Bazel will attempt to treat the NDK as if it was r16. 
This may cause compilation and linkage problems. 
Please download a supported NDK version.
```

Is this warning message out of date? Does TensorFlow for Android now expect/depend upon r17b to function?
